title: Kelly Ripa jokes 'chronically poor' son is experiencing 'extreme poverty' paying rent in Brooklyn
text:
Growing up isn't easy.

Kelly Ripa revealed that her 22-year-old son Michael isn't exactly having the easiest time living on his own in Brooklyn.

The 49-year-old television personality appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live! on Tuesday as she revealed that her eldest of three moved out of the family home and is paying rent on his own.

Real world: Kelly Ripa appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live! on Tuesday as she revealed that her eldest of three moved out of the family home and is paying rent on his own

Ouch: The 49-year-old television personality talked about how hard it has been for eldest son Michael, 22, moving out to Brooklyn, the mother and son duo are pictured January 2018 in NYC

She said: 'I think he loves the freedom. He hates paying his own rent and he’s chronically poor.

'I don’t think he ever really experienced extreme poverty like now.'

Michael is finishing up his studies as a student at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts.

'I don’t think he ever really experienced extreme poverty like now': Kelly joked as he goes to school at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts

'He's experiencing being an adult': As Michael has never had to worry about his finance before, it seems like he is truly understanding the value of a dollar as he is pinching pennies

As Michael has never had to worry about his finance before, it seems like he is truly understanding the value of a dollar as he is pinching pennies and looking forward to holiday money his grandparents send.

Kelly said: 'Now that he’s living on his own, he’s called three times, "Halloween envelope arrived?" Just so he can have electricity. He’s experiencing being an adult.'

The Live With Kelly And Ryan host and actor husband Mark Consuelos have to other children together aside from Michael: son Joaquin, 16, and daughter Lola, 18.

'He’s called three times!' She also said that her son is looking forward to holiday money his grandparents send

Over the summer Kelly also sent Lola off to college at NYU but it didn't take long for her to come back home.

Kelly explained: 'We drop her off on a Saturday and it is the end of summer vacation, so we go back out to Long Island for the rest of the summer.

'Drop her off on a Saturday. Sunday evening, our alarm trips. My daughter’s having a party on the roof of our house! She was gone 12 hours and came home.'

All grown up: Over the summer Kelly also sent 18-year-old daughter Lola off to college at NYU; here they are seen for Lola's prom earlier this season

'She was gone 12 hours and came home': Kelly revealed that it didn't take long for her only daughter to want to come back home

Since her two older children go to the same college, Ripa joked that her youngest son is 'not allowed to apply to NYU.

“He’s not allowed to apply in the Tri-State area,” she joked.

The Live With Kelly And Ryan star has been hosting her ABC talk show on and off since replacing Kathie Lee Gifford opposite Regis Philbin in 2001.
